item.title: Beyond the Trolley Problem
item.description: In the recently published “Trolled by the Trolley Problem”[1] Alexander G. Mirnig and Alexander Meschtscherjakov point out the severe limitations of the trolley problem with regard to ethics- and technology assessment as applied to (semi-)autonomous vehicles. They go on to criticize the amount of effort spent on it and argue for better foci. In this essay, I'll give a short overview over their critique and want to point out other, wider potential issues in need of studying and societal deliberation beyond the artificial, construed confines of the trolley problem.
